comments.body:
Just realized: this may cause a bit of confusion for some users.

`iltorb` is wrapped by libraries like [`shrink-ray-current`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/shrink-ray-current#brotli). While `iltorb` is using `11` as the default value, `shrink-ray-current` is overriding that default with the value `4`. However, since the type definitions for `iltorb` as installed for you when you install `shrink-ray-current`, the hint displayed by your IDE will still claim that the default value is `11`.

I believe the solution is for `shrink-ray-current` to define its own version of `BrotliEncodeParams` with its own JSDocs, in which their default of `4` would be documented. 

(I'm leaving this comment here in case someone gets confused by the discrepancy.)
